entry.title: Pierpont Morgan Library (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the Panic of 1907, the presidents of New York City's banks and trust companies were locked in the Pierpont Morgan Library (pictured)?

entry.title: Yahya Al-Ghotany (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olympic taekwondo practitioner Yahya Al-Ghotany picked up the sport "by chance" at a refugee camp?

entry.title: Christopher Columbus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the opera Christopher Columbus was written by its Jewish composer while fleeing persecution from Nazi Germany by sailing across the Atlantic?

entry.title: The Invincible Dragon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Invincible Dragon was filmed at the Macau police headquarters without permission, leading to the detention of the director and the lead actor?

entry.title: David Gillespie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that David Gillespie became the chief surveyor of the United States boundary commission after the first surveyor was considered to be "insufferably arrogant"?

entry.title: Ani ni Aisaresugite Komattemasu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the creator of Ani ni Aisaresugite Komattemasu ensured a happy ending by not making the main characters blood relatives?

entry.title: Mark Robert Harrison (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that painter Mark Robert Harrison's brother died in a fire that broke out at one of Harrison's own exhibitions in 1846?

entry.title: Cry Baby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that €40,000 of equipment and cash was stolen during the filming of the music video for "Cry Baby"?

entry.title: a leopard seal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that to avoid COVID-19 rule breaches, officials had to discourage people from posting a leopard seal's location online?
